She normally sells her Kenkey in Enyan Kokodo (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Comfort uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Comfort will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will help her to improve her overall sales of Kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to diversify the types of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will help her to improve her overall sales of kenkey

loans.name: Natividad Mariana

texts.es:
La Señora Natividad está realizando su tercer crédito en el banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de un clima frió, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora.
 
La Señora Natividad tiene 58 años, es viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos mayores de edad, casados que viven independientes.

Doña Natividad se dedica a la elaboración de chales y es comerciante de ropa y cosméticos en su tiempo libre, la mayor parte de su tiempo se dedica a su ganado del cual vende la leche que obtiene.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera.

Su meta es tener más ganado y de una mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Natividad has applied for her third loan with the Buscando el Éxito communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has a cold climate. Cuenca is the third most important economic center in the country, and it has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1999. Its people are friendly, kind, and hardworking.

Natividad, 58, is a widow, but she has five children from her marriage. They are all adults who are married and live independently.

Natividad makes shawls and sells clothing and cosmetics in her free time. She dedicates most of her time to her cattle, and she sells the milk they produce.

Her goal is to have more and better-quality livestock.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline is 30 years old, married to Fredrick and they have seven children who are in school.

She has a grocery which she has operated for the past thirteen years in Nakuru. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables from farmers. She repaid her previous loan successfully. With the anticipated profit, she plans to open a general store.

 In the near future Seline hopes to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more  stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is 43 years old, comes from Nyandarua South, and is married with four children who are aged between 13 years and nine years old.

Bilha has a farming business which she has been running for many years and she has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy some fertilizers and seedlings to use in her farm.

She hopes to see her business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 35 years old, married, and supports a family of seven. She has been running a retail shop for the last 13 years, getting a monthly income of KES.28,000.

She learnt about KADET LTD from one of her regular customers, who is registered and has already been funded by KADET LTD. With a loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD, Agnes plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products, e.g., soft drinks, tea leaves, sugar, and wheat and maize flour for sale.


The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into the business for expansion. Her future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 38-year-old farmer, married to Mishek, a businessman. They are blessed with one child. Mercy has been running her dairy farm for the past two years with a monthly income of KES. 11,000 which she uses to sustain her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after she was introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mercy will use the loan to buy animal feed and build a cow shed for her cattle. 


With the anticipated profits from the business, she will improve the living standards of her family. She hopes to venture into horticultural farming.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and build a cow shed

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 53 years old, married to Sammy, and supports a family of ten members. She operates a large clothing outlet in Bomet town that deals with the sale of school uniform and cultural outfits.

She is a long serving Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) client who was introduced to them by a colleague. She has acquired an emergency loan of 70,000 KES which will be used to pay for a new premises.

The proceeds will be used for business expansion as well as for catering to the family's basic needs. Her hope is to enlarge her business into a highly profitable outlet.

loans.use: to pay for a new premises.

loans.name: Nancy Imelda

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy está realizando su tercer crédito en el banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de un clima frió, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora.
 
La Señora. Nancy tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 6 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su último hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad, pero su emoción más grande es porque se encuentra esperando la llegada de su cuarto hijo ya que esta de 6 meses de gestación. Su esposo se dedica a un negocio que es de su propiedad, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Nancy se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa ya que nunca se descuida de sus hijos, por el momento se dedica a trabajar desde su casa y está tejiendo chompas, bufandas y gorras de lana, esta realizando esta actividad ya que se está cuidando debido a su embarazo. Por el momento también está siguiendo un curso de cocina.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de lana para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Su meta es tener una cafetería.
texts.en:
Nancy is requesting her third loan with the Buscando el Éxito community bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has a cold climate and is the third most important city economically in the country.  In December 1999 it became a Cultural World Heritage site.  Its people are friendly, kind, and hardworking.

Nancy is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are 6, 14, and 16 years old.  Her two older children are in high school and her youngest attends a school in the city.  Her emotion is great because she is six months pregnant with her fourth child.  Her husband works at his own business and they own their home.

Nancy takes care of her home and always cares for her children, so currently she is working from her home.  She is knitting wool sweaters, scarves, and hats.  She is doing this work because she is being careful during her pregnancy.  She is also currently taking a cooking course.

She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of wool to continue growing her business.

Her goal is to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase wool.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is still in the poultry business although now she has started grazing cows and crop farming as well. Her business is doing well and she is happy about it.

She has currently borrowed her fifth loan after having repaid the previous ones well. She intends to use this money to purchase a dairy cow and farm inputs for her farm. She anticipates getting profits from which she will expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

Her dreams are to expand her business and give the best education possible to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and some farm inputs.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel does farming in the Kangundo area. She rears dairy cows as well as plants: cash crops such maize, beans and vegetables for sale. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children.

This is her second loan and she plans use the loan amount to buy feed for her dairy cows. She also plans to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. From the profits that she will generate from the sale of milk and the farm produce, she will pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her farming business by buying more dairy cows and planting more cash crops.  Hence,  she will make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed for cows and farm inputs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is still selling cereals but her income has now increased to KES 24,500 after the previous capital boost from the loan advanced to her.

This will be her second loan from KADET and it will help her to add more cereals to her inventory.  The anticipated profit will be used to educate her children. 

Her hopes are to have an expanded business and have an economically stable family.

loans.use: to stock more cereals for her business

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 50-year-old dairy farmer. He is married to Lucy, a business lady. They are blessed with three children. He has been dairy farming as well as supplying milk to his customers for the past three years with a monthly income of 3,000 KES which he uses to support his family. 

Samson is applying for his third loan term from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) after having repaid the previous loans successfully. His dairy farm is doing well. He will use the loan to purchase milk containers for supplying milk. With the anticipated profits from his farm he will educate his children.  

His hopes and dreams are to purchase a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase milk containers for supplying milk.

loans.name: Panin

texts.en:
Panin is 30 years old and married to Kimanyisho. They are blessed with two children aged four years and two years. Panin has been in the farming business for the last three years with a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

Panin has taken his second loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) of 40,000 KES with which he plans to purchase sheep, goats and farm inputs.

With the anticipated profit Panin will buy more cattle. His hopes and dream is to raise his business to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and to buy sheep and goats to rear for sale.

loans.name: Erika María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mini Bankito se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Erika, tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de 3 años, ella vive con su mamá. Este su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos. 

Doña Erika es una mujer muy luchadora que día a día trabaja para darle lo mejor a su hijo y que le falte nada, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y en las tardes también en las tardes vende comida rápida, ella vende hamburguesas, salchipapas, chuzos, sodas y jugos naturales. En las mañanas realiza sus recorridos y por las tardes y noches se dedica a la venta de los alimentos, tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a esto ella sale adelante sola con su hijo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y víveres para preparar los alimentos.
 
Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
The Mini Bankito communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa settlement, known as the "Sultan of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crops, which have an incomparable flavor, and for its food and warmth of its people.

Erika lives here.  She is 24 years old and is the single mother of a three year old son.  She lives with her mother and this will be her fifth cycle with the communal bank.  She likes it because of the help it has given her through the loans.

Erika is a hardworking woman who works daily to provide the best for her son, so that he needs for nothing.  She sells all types of clothing and also sells fast food in the evenings.  She sells hamburgers, sausage and potatoes, chuzos, sodas, and juices.  In the mornings she makes her rounds and sells food in the evenings and at night.  She's been doing this for more than 10 years and thanks to this she is getting herself and her son ahead.

She will use this loan to buy clothing and ingredients to prepare her food.

Her dream is to provide the best for her young son.

loans.use: to buy clothing and ingredients.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco Nuevo Amanecer está formado por 8 mujeres y 1 hombre quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que tiene hermosos paisajes gracias a su geografía accidentada, se puede disfrutar de la naturaleza, la arquitectura de sus casas es una mezcla de lo tradicional con lo moderno. Su gente al igual que las socias son personas de un buen corazón, muy amables y gentiles, todos los días se encuentran en la lucha para mejorar su estabilidad económica y lo están logrando gracias a su trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación, realizan tareas del campo como es la crianza de animales, la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en otras actividades económicas, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Elda, está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras, le gusta este tipo de créditos porque les ayuda a mejorar su estabilidad economía.

La Señora. Elda tiene 39 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos quienes se encuentran de 22, 20, 18, 18, 16 y 13 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven de manera independiente, sus dos hijas gemelas se encuentran trabajando para sus gastos personales, también están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su hijo de 16 años está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su último hijo quien tiene una discapacidad está estudiando en una escuelita para niños especiales, su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Nuestra socia hace 20 años se dedica a la limpieza de diferentes casas, esta actividad la realiza de lunes a sábados, sin un horario fijo, trabajo que le ha permitido mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en el pago de los estudios de su hijo con discapacidad, va a comprar uniformes, libros, cuadernos, lápices, etc. 

Su sueño es de ver que un día sus hijos lleguen a tener una profesión.

La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer community bank is made up of eight women and one man who live in the area around the Zhidmad parish in Cuenca.  The area is known for its beautiful landscapes thanks to its rugged geography and it is possible to enjoy nature.  The architecture of the homes is a mix of modern and traditional.  The people, including the group members, are people with good hearts who are friendly and kind.  Every day they are in a fight to improve their financial stability and they are succeeding thanks to their work, effort, and dedication.  They do work such as raising animals, farming, and many work in the city at other economic activities while maintaining the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of this group is Elda, who is requesting her second loan together with her friends and companions.  She likes this type of loan because it helps them improve their financial stability.  Elda is 39 years old, married, and has six children who are 13, 16, 18, 18, 20, and 22 years old.  Her two oldest children are married and live independently.  Her twin daughters work for their personal expenses and are also studying at a school in the city.  Her 16 year old son is also studying at a school in the city.  Her youngest son who has a disability is studying at a school for special children.  Her husband works in construction as a builder.  They do not own their home, so they rent.

Elda has worked for 20 years cleaning houses.  She works from Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule.  This work has allowed her to improve her household's financial stability.  

She will use the money from this loan to pay for her disabled son to attend school.  She will purchase uniforms, books, notebooks, pencils, and other items.

Her dream is to see her children one day have professions.  

The small photo is of two members who were not able to be present when they took the group photo.

loans.use: to purchase uniforms, books, notebooks, and pencils.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, casada con una hija menor de edad, ella es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de actividades recreativas con su hija, y pasar tiempo de calidad. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera  por falta de recursos económico, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.

Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en sus casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestible en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, de shampoo, de salsas, de sopas, arroz, frijoles, pan, leche, azúcar y otros. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Maribel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países  pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un  medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maribel is married and has one dependent daughter.  She is from León which is located in the west of the country.  Maribel is known for being very hard working, responsible and having a desire to improve herself.  In her spare time, she enjoys taking part in recreational activities together with her daughter and spending quality time with her.  Unfortunately, she was unable to study for a degree owing to a lack of financial resources but she would have liked to have studied nursing.

Thanks to her strong spirit and her desire to make progress, Maribel has a 'pulperia' business located in her home.  A 'pulperia' is a small store that sells food products in small quantities such as sachets of coffee, shampoo, sauces, soups, rice, beans, bread, milk, sugar, etc.  Maribel works 12 hours a day in her business, selling her products.  Her goal for this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with food products so that, in the not-so-distant future, she can earn better income.  Maribel is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to people with limited financial resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her store with items such as coffee, shampoo, sauces, soups, rice, beans, bread, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Penina is now 55 years old and her five children are doing well. She is still operating her mill in Narok area and her income has now increased to Kes 25,000 per month.

Penina has now requested her third loan of KES 70,000 from KADET LTD, and she intends to use it to purchase more stock of cereals which she will mill and sell as flour. The anticipated profits will used to boost the business. 

Her dream is to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy cereals to mill for resale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 39-year-old businessman; he is married to Lucy who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with two children. He has been selling cereals and other farm produce for the past eleven years, with a monthly income of KES 13,000 which he uses to support his family. He also operates a taxi to supplement his income. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. David will use the loan to add to his stock of rice, sorghum, green grams, peas, etc. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will improve his business and educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to supply his farm produce to surrounding towns like Nairobi.

loans.use: to add to his stock of rice, sorghum, green grams (lentils), peas, etc

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 47-year-old lady from Kisumu city. She is married to Asweto who is a businessman and was blessed with three children who are 14, 12 and seven years old.

She hires out plastic seats to people whenever they have a function within their homes and at the market. She has been doing this business for the last four years and makes a monthly income of KES. 34,000. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more plastic chairs, hence expanding the business. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to grow her business and to open a catering center so as to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic seats to hire out

loans.name: Tusitala

texts.en: Tusitala is 54 years old and married with one child. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as rice, sugar, flour, salt, onions and tinned fish. She has been doing this for 7 years. Tusitala needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, bags of rice, snacks, soft drinks, tinned fish, dripping oil, salt, corn beef and onions. She hopes to use her profits to extend her shop. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, bags of rice, snacks, soft drinks, tinned fish, dripping oil, salt, corn beef and onions.

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en: Mr. Erdenebayar, who is 38 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on their own plot of land. He has been running a taxi service to local people since 2009 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers, driving them to their destination quickly and taking short routes. His wife has been making and selling Mongolian traditional clothes, called deel, to local people. Using his previous loan, he purchased an electric sewing machine for his wife's business in order to increase her labor efficiency. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase some sheep. During the summer time, he will feed the sheep and later in autumn he will sell them at a higher price in the markets. By beginning this business, he will improve his family's living condition greatly. Mr. Erdenebayar is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en: Mr. Erdenebat, who is 52 years old, lives with his wife, daughter and grandchild in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son lives separately from his parents and using his previous loan Mr Erdenebat had purchased a Mongolian traditional portable felt dwelling as a wedding gift to his son and daughter-in-law. His daughter studies at a medical college. During this time period, the final exams of universities begin and the university administration demands its students to pay the remaining tuition fee. He is therefore requesting a loan of 1,700,000 MNT in order to pay for his daughter's university tuition fee. As a result, his daughter will be able to sit her final exams and advance to the next grade. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's remaining university tuition fee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy paper and other material for her husband's printing press business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 28 years old and works as a hawker of African women's clothing material and also sells coconuts in her Utange village of  Mombasa. She is a married woman and together with her spouse, she supports five children in their family. She has been in this business for the last nine years and has done well.

This marks her second time borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business, after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use this loan to purchase additional African clothing material and the anticipated profit to expand her businesses. She hopes to live a successful life in future.

loans.use: to purchase additional African women's clothing materials for resale

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 23 years old and a metal fabricator in Voi, Kenya, He is a single man who has been in his field for the last five years and has done great.

This marks his second time borrowing to finance his business, after repaying the first loan successfully. He will use the requested loan to purchase steel for making grills for windows and doors and the anticipated profit to repay his loan. 

He hopes to be the leading steel fabricator in Voi.

loans.use: to purchase steel for making grills for windows and doors

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en:
Hellena is a 48-year-old greengrocer in Voi, Kenya. She is a married mother of two children whose husband gives support with additional income and she has been in this business for the last ten years and is doing well. 

This marks her fifth time borrowing to finance her business, and she will use the loan to purchase green vegetables and fruits for her grocery shop and the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to grow her business to selling wholesale in future.

loans.use: to  purchase green vegetables and fruits for her grocery shop

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 27 years old, a retail shop owner in Voi, Kenya. She is a single lady who supports no one but herself. She has been in this business for the last one and a half years and is doing very well.

This marks her second time borrowing to finance her business, and she will use the loan to purchase cooking fat, sugar, crates of milk, and bales of wheat and maize flour, and the anticipated profit to repay her loan. 

She hopes to grow her retail business to wholesale in future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, sugar, crates of milk, and bales of wheat and maize flour

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Fatou est une femme mariée. Elle vit au Sénégal avec sa famille. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et pratique  la vente de légumes et de condiments qui  constitue sa principale source   de revenus. Elle capitalise une expérience de plus de  05 ans dans son activité. Elle est membre à de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  ou elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite à nouveau un  crédit de 200.000 francs CFA prévu pour acheter les produits qu’elle commercialise et qui seront  destinés à la vente. Avec son financement elle pourra  renforcer son fonds de roulement ce qui lui permettra d’acheter d’avantage de légumes afin de satisfaire la demande croissante de sa clientèle. Par conséquent, avec l’augmentation de ses bénéfices, elle compte  diversifier davantage ses produits pour développer son activité. Elle souhaite obtenir une grande boutique où elle pourra exercer son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndeye Fatou is a married woman who lives in Senegal with her family. She works in commerce and sells vegetables and condiments, which constitute her main source of income. She capitalizes on over five years of experience in this business. 

She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch where she has already paid back a previous loan. She is again requesting a loan of 200,000 francs CFA for purchasing the goods that she markets and that will be for sale. Her financing will bolster her working capital enabling her to purchase more vegetables, so as to satisfy her customers' growing demand for vegetables. 

Consequently, with the increase in profits, she plans on diversifying her goods further to develop her business. She would like to have a big store, where she can operate her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard, 27 years old, runs a retail shop business in Emali town. He is married and has two children. Besides the retail shop, he also has a barber shop in the same area.


This is his third loan and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of goods to sell. These include sugar, rice, and cooking oil as well as shaving machines for his barber shop business. 


He will save some of the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to grow his business and open a mini-supermarket.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, and cooking oil, etc. to stock for sale as well as shaving machines for his barber shop

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is 26 years old and sells grocery items such as vegetables, carrots, garlic and fruits. She has been in this business for two years and it has been profitable. She is married to Benard who supports the family with the income he gets from his business.

This is her first loan and she plans to buy more stock of vegetables, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, oranges and bananas. She will use the generated income to add more stock of fruits and vegetables.

She hopes to grow her business and open a grocery store in the market place.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 36 years old, married and has two children. He is a dairy farmer in Kangundo town. He supplies milk to various dairy shops and retail shops in the area as well as sells some at the market place. He has been in this business for seven years now. Besides dairy farming, he also plants cash crops such as maize and vegetables to sell.

This is his second loan term and he plans to use the loan amount to buy feeds for his dairy cows. He also plans to buy seedlings for planting. He anticipates to make more income with which he will be able to pay school fees for his children and also buy another dairy cow.

He hopes to improve his farming methods and become one of the best farmers in the area.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed for his cows.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a cash crop and dairy farmer in Kangundo town. He is 31 years old, and married to Jackline who is also a farmer. They have two children. He supplies milk to various dairy shops in the area and also sells maize and vegetables at the market place. He has been in this business for six years and it has been profitable.

This is his first loan and he plans to use the loan amount to buy feeds for his dairy cows. He also plans to buy seedlings for planting. He anticipates to make more income with which he will pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to improve both his farming skills and farming methods and become one of the best farmers in the area.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 26-year-old married man with 2 children. He is applying a loan of 20,000 KES that will be used to purchase second-hand clothes to resell. He has been running this business for the past 2 years in the Mombasa area. He describes the environment as stable and supplies the clothes to local customers. The anticipated profits will be used to restock and further expand his business. This will be his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Agueda Luz

texts.es:
Águeda Luz de 45 años de edad, soltera con un hijo que estudia en secundaria. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Agueda se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal; en sus ratos libre le gustar pasar tiempo de calidad con sus familia y les prepara un plato típico de la región como es “yuca con chingaste” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería general como pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa cosméticos, zapatos, prendas. El dedica  a su actividad unas 10 horas diarias, negocio que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Agueda Luz agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Águeda Luz is 45 years old, single and has a son who is currently in secondary school.  She is originally from León, in the west of the country. Águeda is hard-working, responsible and has a great desire to get ahead in life.  In her spare time she likes to spend quality time with her family and to prepare some of the region's typical dishes such as "yuca con chingaste" (a yucca and pork dish).  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, Águeda could not study and was forced to work from a young age in order to help with household costs.

Thanks to her spirit and her desire to prosper, Águeda works selling general merchandise such as trousers, shirts, skirts, clothes, cosmetics and shoes.  She works around ten hours per day, with the business being run out of her home.  This loan will be used to invest in working capital and to stock up the business buying merchandise so that, in the near future, she can earn a higher income.  Águeda is grateful to Kiva lenders who are providing people of few resources and poor countries, such as Nicaragua, the chance at having a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up her business buying merchandise such as trousers, shirts, skirts, clothes, cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock of retail products like sugar, flour and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits, vegetables and coconuts.

loans.name: Mbeneka

texts.en:
Mbeneka, 54 years old and married, sells grocery items and cereals in the town of Emali. In this profitable business for 21 years, she is requesting her eleventh loan to buy vegetables, tomatoes, maize, rice and beans to sell.

Mbeneka will use the generated income to pay school fees for her grandchildren. She also hopes to expand her business and open another cereals and grocery stall in the market.

loans.use: To buy more cereals, vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Muia

texts.en:
Muia is grateful for the progress his businesses have made over the last year. He sold more curios, and the cosmetics shop also provided increased income. He would therefore like to increase the level of stock in both ventures.

Muia is requesting a loan of 104,800 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional curios and cosmetics to sell. He is confident the enterprises will generate sufficient profit both to repay the loan and help him to better meet the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional curios ans cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is grateful to Milango for the capital she received to improve on her business. From the extra income, she was able to pay school fees for her children and set up a retail shop dealing in sale of both charcoal and other durable food stock.

Zawadi is now applying for a loan of 42,700 Kenya shillings to buy new stock for the grocery, retail and charcoal shop and also pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy new stock for the grocery, retail and charcoal shop and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Nuevos Horizontes  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes está formado por 8 mujeres luchadoras que a diario están en la búsqueda para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y  sacar adelante a sus familias, trabajan en diferentes actividades pero en especial el comercio, son mujeres muy alegres, carismáticas y siempre nos brindan una sonrisa, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones que sus padres les inculcaron. Viven en la ciudad  de Cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha belleza natural y patrimonial, de clima frió, aun  conservan la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Rosario, forma parte del banco comunal desde hace 14 años, la banca comunal le gusta por la unión y compañerismo que existe entre todas sus amigas y compañeras, ya que en vez de ser un grupo de amigas casi son como una familia, al mismo tiempo el crédito le ayuda a mejorar su economía.

Doña María Rosa tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos mayores de edad que viven de independiente ya que son casados y han formado sus propias familias. La casa en la que vive es propia fruto de su trabajo.

La Señora. María Rosa se dedica desde hace 45 años al comercio de frutas, trabaja todos los días de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, en su casa cria cuyes a los que los vende en la ciudad.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra frutas de temporada. 

Su meta es continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes communal bank is made up of eight hardworking ladies who are constantly in search of better financial stability in their homes and for ways to get their families ahead.  They have different businesses but especially they are merchants.  They are very happy, charismatic ladies who always smile and still maintain their culture and traditions that their parents taught them.  They live in the city of Cuenca, a place that has great natural and cultural beauty, a cool climate, and that maintains the people's culture and traditions.

Maria Rosario has been a member of the communal bank for 14 years and she enjoys it because of the unity and camaraderie that exists between all of her friends and fellow members.  Rather than being just a group of friends, they are like a family.  At the same time, the loan helps her improve her finances.

Maria Rosa is 62 years old, is a single mother of two adult children who live on their own.  They are married and have their own families.  Her house is the fruit of her own labor.

Maria Rosa has been a fruit merchant for 45 years and works seven days a week without a fixed schedule.  She raises Guinea pigs in her home and sells them in the city.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy seasonal fruits.  Her goal is to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit..

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a married lady, age 28, supporting a family of five members. She is a tailor in Koibatek town and has been in operation for a period of five years, earning an income of 20,000 KES.

She has borrowed a second loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD and intends to purchase textile materials for mending clothes for resale. The profits she earns will be used to purchase more textile materials for her business.

Her dream is to see her business expand and to purchase more sewing machines.

loans.use: to purchase textile materials.

loans.name: Hendrika

texts.en:
Hendrika is grateful to Milango because of the impact of capital previously injected into her business. She was able to pay for her children's education and also set up a fish selling stall. Due to increased clientele, Hendrika is applying for a loan of 42,650 Kenya shillings to buy food stock for the restaurant, fish for resale and also a new stock of charcoal to set up a charcoal selling business.

She believes the businesses will be able to cover the required repayments.

loans.use: to buy food stock for the restaurant, fish for resale, and a new stock of charcoal to set up a new business.

loans.name: Mustafakul

texts.en:
Mustafakul is 62 years old. He and his wife are happy and have four children and five grandchildren. He is very hardworking and kind natured. He has a lot of friends and all of them love him very much.

Mustafakul has been farming for ten years, producing crops. He has been in this line of work since he was a boy, so all of his experience has been dedicated to producing crops. His products are sold at the local market in the city.

In order to provide his crops with the needed attention, Mustafakul is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 Somoni so that he can buy fertilizer and continue improving his crop production. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for land where he grows crops.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Yoff 33 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe 33 est un démembrement  d’un groupement d’intérêt économique qui répond au nom de Makarimal  Akhlakh. Il est formé de 10 femmes qui habite dans la même localité et qui exerce la même activité commerciale : la vente de poissons frais. Elles se sont connues à travers des tours hebdomadaires qu’elles organisaient et qui se faisait à tour de rôle. Leur représentante est  la personne qui a levé la main sur la photo, elle se nomme Fatou . C’est une femme marié et cela fait plus de 10 ans qu’elle pratique la vente de poissons. Elle adhérente à l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un prêt pour renforcer son fonds de roulement. Elle aimerait augmenter son offre de produits pour satisfaire la demande de ses clients qu’elle est incapable de répondre par ses propres moyen. Cela lui permettra de booster ses ventes et de gagner plus d’argent. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de rendre meilleur les conditions alimentaires de sa famille et de hausser  le niveau de son épargne. Elle souhaite un jour devenir une grande  mareyeuse.
texts.en:
The "33" group is a remnant of an economic interest group named Makarimal Akhlakh. It comprises ten women who live in the same town and who have the same businesses: selling fresh fish. The women know one another through weekly excursions they take turns organizing. Their representative is the person in the photo with her hand raised. Her name is Fatou. She is a married woman and has been operating her business selling fish for over ten years. 

Fatou joined a U-IMCEC branch where she is requesting a loan to bolster her working capital. She would like to  increase the goods she offers to satisfy customer demands, which she cannot meet with her own funds. The new loan will enable her to boost her sales and to earn more money. The profits will enable her to improve her family's food situation and to raise her savings level. One day, she would like to become a major wholesaler of fish.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Osillas Santiago

texts.es: Osillas Santiago mayor de edad casado con seis hijos, del docimicilio de Chinandega, zona muy productiva en el ron, azucar, comercicios entre otros mas, Osillas es un hombre que3 ha luchado desde muy temprana edad ya que viene de una familia muy humilde siendo el uno de los mayores de sus hermanos, el cual tuvo que salir a trabajar para que sus hermanos pequeños pudieran estudiar quedando el solo con la primaria donde aprende a leer y a escribir, poco a poco ha ido mejorando ahora su vivienda donde el habita con su familia, osillas con los prestamos que ha obtenido ha logrado terminar una parte de sus vivienda pero ahora el necesita terminar de construir un porche que aun no cierra por falta de materiales de construccion, al igual que cerrar cierta area del perimetro de su vivienda, Osillas esta solicitando financiamiento para la compra de materiales de contruccion como: cemento, hierro, ladrillos, zinc, perlines, ceramica entre otros.
texts.en: Osillas Santiago is an older married gentleman with six children. He lives in Chinandega, an area that produces a lot of rum, sugar and stores, among other businesses. Osillas is a man who has struggled from a very young age because he came from a very humble family. Because he was one of the older children out of his siblings, he had to leave the house and work so that his youngest siblings would be able to go to school. As a result, he only finished primary school where he learned to read and write. Little by little he has improved his life and today he has his own home where he lives with his family. With the loans he obtained he was able to complete a part of his home. However, now he needs to complete the construction of a front porch that is incomplete and open because he lacks the construction materials. This project will also complete a portion of the perimeter of his home. Osillas is seeking this loan to buy construction materials including cement, iron, bricks, zinc, rafters, and tiles, among other items.

loans.use: to buy iron, zinc, rafters, tiles, cement, and bricks, among other items.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 48-year-old married man with seven children. He describes himself as an ambitious man who has vision for his business to grow. He has been operating a fish selling business in the Kisumu area for the past four years and it's next to the lake. Customers are usually traders from nearby villages. Samuel is applying for a loan of 20,000 KES that will be used to purchase fish for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to increase the amount of area he is supplying to and stock. This will be his first loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Batzaya

texts.en: Batzaya, 26 years old, lives with his wife and newborn baby in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in rented apartment. Batzaya has been providing web hosting services since 2010, and managed to secure its market share. During the past three years, he has created jobs by employing three people. Currently, his wife is unemployed, staying at home looking after their new baby. Last year, Batzaya purchased land and began building his own house. However, due to lack of finance, they haven't finished building their house and some necessary building materials are required. So he is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials, such as shingles, planks, bricks and more blocks. He wants to finish building his house as soon as possible and move into his house before winter. Renting an apartment is costly compared to owning a house. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposo y sus 6 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Norma pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de corte y confección, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocer ropa para sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pescado Frito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Norma trabaja brindando servicios de costura y confecciona de prendas de vestir, ella trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Norma cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Norma se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una maquina remalladora, la cual le servirá de  mucho para darle un mejor acabado a sus costuras, de esta manea Norma podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un taller de confecciones.
texts.en:
Norma is a 42 year old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and her 6 children who she loves and who are her primary motivation in life. She is a very friendly person, a hard worker and enthusiastic. Together with her husband, she dedicates all of her efforts to getting her family ahead. Thanks to her strength and the support of her parents she was able to study and obtain a technical seamstress degree. In her free time she likes to sew clothes for her children and sometimes she cooks rich fried fish to share with her family.

By her own initiative, with much determination and dedication, she works providing sewing and design services for articles of clothing. She works everyday and she can work for approximately 10 hours a day. Norma believes her business does well because of her experience, and her friendly treatment of others. Norma is very grateful for the Kiva loans. Thanks to the loans she will be able to purchase an overlock sewing machine which will serve her very well by improving the finish of her clothes. This way, Norma will be able to serve more clients and continue working and struggling to accomplish her greatest dream of owning a clothing workshop.

loans.use: to buy an overlocking sewing machine.

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señorita Karina, tiene 28 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ella es Ing. en Contabilidad, especialidad que con mucho esfuerzo logro.

Karina para obtener recursos para sus gastos y también con esto ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar desde hace tres años tiene un local por el centro de la ciudad en el cual puso una copiadora, luego y con la ayuda de los créditos ha ido surtiendo una pequeña papelería la misma que en la actualidad la tiene muy bien surtida, trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de sus mamá que es quien atiende el negocio cuando ella no está o sale a realizar trabajos contables ya que también desempeña como contadora en varios lugares.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar cuadernos, lápices y todo tipo de útiles escolares ya que se viene la entrada a clases y es cuando más se venden estos productos. Lleva más de tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener una papelería más grande.
texts.en:
The "San Esteban" communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  The area is known for its traditional culture and because it is only a few minutes away from the province's best beaches, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Karina lives here in Charapoto. She is 28 year old, single and living with her parents.  She has a degree in accounting, something she achieved after much effort.

In order to cover her costs and to help her parents with household costs, Karina has had a shop in the city centre for three years.  There she started with a photocopying machine and, later, with the help of loans, she managed to build up a small stationery shop.  It is now very well-stocked and Karina works there every day, with help from her mother who serves customers when Karina is not there or when she has to go out for other accounting jobs - Karina also works as an accountant in various places.

This new loan will be used to buy notebooks, pens and all types of school materials as classes will soon be starting and this is when these products sell most.  Karina has been with the communal bank for three years and she likes it because the loans have helped her with her business a great deal.

Karina's dream is to have a bigger stationery shop.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens and all types of school materials.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is married with five children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for seven years, selling to all kinds of people, but on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income from a restaurant. She works from her home and sells to all kinds of people, but on retail basis only, and works six days every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 years old, married, and blessed with three children between the ages of 3 and 15 years old. She gets support from her spouse in meeting some of her family's financial needs. She has been selling second hand clothes in Kapsabet town for the past 13 years. From this business, she makes a monthly profit of 12,000 KES. 

Joyce has borrowed a loan of 60,000 KES after successfully repaying her previous loans. With this loan, she intends to purchase a bale of trouser suits, towels and other types of clothes, depending on the market demand.

With the anticipated profits, she will pay school fees for her children and use some of the money to expand her business. Her dream and hope is to expand her business into a clothing wholesale shop and to be able to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of trouser suits, towels and other types of clothes, depending on the market demand.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 37 years old and supports a family of eight. His spouse supports him in meeting some of his family's financial needs. He has been running a Posho mill business for the past two years. From this business, he makes a monthly profit of 25,000 KES.

He has borrowed a second loan of 50,000 KES and he plans to buy dry maize for milling. He anticipates getting profits, with which he intends to pay school fees for his children and use the rest to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize for milling.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married businesswoman and runs a food cafe, which has been in operation for three years. 

Ruth was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

Despite the challenge of bad debt, Ruth believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children, provide a means of income for the other employees and also use part of the money to open a larger cafe.

loans.use: to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc., for the cafe.

loans.name: Abib

texts.fr: Monsieur Abib est un habitant du Sénégal. Il est père de famille et il s’active dans le secteur du transport. Il est taximan depuis plus de 03 ans. C’est grâce aux revenus que lui procure   son taxi qu’il gère les charges de sa famille (nourriture, factures…etc.). Il est adhèrent à l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il a obtenu auparavant un crédit antérieur. Il sollicite à nouveau un prêt de 400 000 frs             qu’il emploiera pour payer les frais d’entretien de son taxi. En  Effet, il veut remettre son taxi en état afin de le rendre plus confortable et mieux le rentabiliser. Par conséquent, il pourra avec l’amélioration de ses gains, contribuer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille et faire plus d’économie pour prévenir les imprévus. Il désire obtenir un autre taxi pour développer davantage son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abib is an inhabitant of Senegal. He is a father and active in the transportation sector. He has been a taxi driver for three years. Thanks to the income his taxi brings in, he is managing family expenses (food, bills, etc.) 

He joined a U-IMCEC branch where he obtained a previous loan before. He is again requesting a loan of 400,000 francs that he will use to cover the costs of maintaing his taxi. Basically, he wants to return his taxi to good shape to make it more comfortable and more profitable. Consequently, he will be able to improve his profits, do more to improve his family's food situation, and save more money to prepare for the unforeseen. He would like to obtain another taxi to develop his business further.

loans.use: to cover the costs of sheetmetal work and renovate his taxi

loans.name: Mevis Nubia

texts.es:
Doña Mevis tiene un negocio de pulpería y de licorería, su negocio lo inicio desde hace siete años con esfuerzos propios.
Este cliente es viuda, vive con una nieta que es la que le ayuda a atender la venta.
Tiene ocho años de dedicarse a esta actividad comercial.
Tiene dos hijos mayores de edad ya casados y con su propia casa.
Solicita financiamiento para compra de más granos básicos y productos lácteos que son los productos que se mueven a diario. Además de la pulpería vende ropa variada y cosméticos.
Estos financiamientos le han ayudado a mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en: Mevis owns a grocery and liquor store. She started her business by herself seven years ago. She is a widow. She lives with her granddaughter who helps her attend to the store. She has spent eight years working on this business. She has two children who are grown and married with their own homes. She seeks financing to buy more basic grains and the milk products she sells every day. In addition to the grocery store, she sells various clothing and cosmetics. This loan will help her to improve her business and the quality of her family's life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, rice, sugar, oil, milk products, cheese, milk, cream and  sausages.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Benard is still practicing mixed farming in Olkalau and his business is doing well. 

He has now applied for his fifth loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy a dairy cow. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. With the anticipated profits, he hopes to pay the loan and expand his farming business. 

In the future, he hopes to increase the number of livestock and expand his farming business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has three school-going children. He sells horticultural produce, such as mangoes, plums, passion fruit, oranges, etc. He has been operating this business for ten years. Apart from this business, he earns a salary from renting hand carts.

Stephen learned about Milango through a friend, with the aim of accessing credit to better his business operations. The main challenge he faces is the scarcity of stock and high transport costs. 

Stephen is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenyan shillings to buy more fruit for resale. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business, open other branches, and pay for school fees. His future plan in five years time is to buy a truck for transporting the products to other areas.

loans.use: to buy more fruit for resale.

loans.name: Dongard

texts.en:
Dongard lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for eight months. In this business, he sells retail stock, such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil etc. 

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is price fluctuations. 

Dongard is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel is 36 years old, married and the father of one child. For the past nine years, he has earned a living by selling shoes in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of 20,000 KES. 

Nathaniel was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for his sixth loan of 100,000 KES to buy additional stock of shoes for his business to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his child, as well as expand the shoe business. 

Nathaniel's goal for the future is to continue growing his shoe business so that he may provide his family with a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of shoes for his business.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Yoff 35 Group

texts.fr: Makarimal akhlah g35 est un groupe de 10 femmes issu du groupement d’intérêt économique Makarimal Akhlah. Elles s’activent   toutes  dans le secteur du commerce,  et certaines d’entre elles  font  l’import-export à l’instar de leur chef de groupe Mame Dado. C’est une  femme célibataire et elle s’identifie sur la photo par celle qui a levé la main. Elle est membre à l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC auprès duquel elle sollicite un prêt en guise de renfort pour son fonds de roulement afin qu’elle parvienne à augmenter la quantité de ses divers marchandises (tissus, chaussures, bracelets…etc.) qu’elle propose  à sa clientèle. La rentabilité de ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille et de faire plus d’économies pour mieux faire face aux imprévus. Ultérieurement, elle voudrait bénéficier d’un  autre financement avec une somme beaucoup plus consistante qui lui permettra d’importer des conteneurs.
texts.en:
"Makarimal akhlah g35" is a group of ten women from the same economic interest group called Makarimal Akhlah. The women are all active in commerce. Some of them work import-export, just like the group leader Mame Dado. She is an unmarried woman, and she appears in the photo with her hand raised. 

Mame Dado is a member of a U-IMCEC branch where she is requesting a loan to bolster her working capital, so that she may be able to increase the amount of her various goods (fabrics, shoes, bracelets, … etc.) that she offers to her customers. The profitability of this financing will enable her to improve her family's food situation and to save more money to cope with the unexpected. Beyond this, she would like to obtain a larger loan enabling her to import transportainers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (fabrics, shoes, jewelry) to sell

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married businesswoman and owns a farming business. She keeps poultry. Besides this, she also runs a transport business. The business has been running for four years. Dorine has four school-going children.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is competition from others.

Dorine is applying for a loan of 85,100 Kenya shillings to buy more chicks and feed. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to purchase more stock. Her desire is also to keep layer chickens in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food stock, such as rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking fat, etc., for his café.

loans.name: Letiya

texts.en:
Letiya is 32 years old, married, and the father of four children between the ages of 2 years old and 15 years old. He is a maize farmer, farming maize on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the past ten years. 

He learned about KADET LTD from women who are already registered members of KADET LTD. This will be his first loan of 50,000 KES, which he plans to use to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his maize farm. Because of the climatic conditions and fertile soil, maize has been proven to do very well and also the market is readily available in the area for both retail and wholesale buyers. 

Letiya hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Ana Hercilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta  relación tiene dos  hijos todos mayores de edad  e independientes. El marido trabaja con ella.

Doña Ana con su esposo tienen un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabajan de lunes a sábados desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las tres de la tarde ya que solo preparan almuerzos. Tienen su comedor por 3 años y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos y porque día a día ella varia el menú para darles a sus clientes algo diferente, mientras ella se encarga de cocinar y servir, el esposo atiende a los clientes dando la mejor atención posible ya que así ganan más clientela.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 3 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio el cual hoy les permite salir adelante.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener salud ante todo.
texts.en:
The "San Esteban" communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto. The area is known for its traditional culture and because it is only a few minutes away from the province's best beaches, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Ana, 53 years old, lives here in the city of Charapoto.  She is married and has two children with her husband.  Both are now independent adults.  Ana's husband works with Ana.

Ana and her husband have a small dining room in their house where they prepare delicious meals.  The work from Monday to Saturday, from 6am until 3pm, as they only offer lunch.  They have had the business for three years and the business is going well as customers likes the flavours and because Ana varies the menu every day in order to give her customers something different.  While Ana cooks, her husband acts as waiter, giving customers the best possible service, as that is how they will attract more customers.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, fish and other supplies to prepare meals.  Ana has been with the communal bank for three years and she likes it as it was with her first loan that she started this business which has allowed her to prosper.

Ana's goals are to continue moving forward and, above all, to maintain good health.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other supplies.

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is 58 years old, married, and the mother of five children. For the past 21 years, she has earned a living by supplying water in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 18,200 KES. 

Mebakari was introduced KADET by a credit officer and she is applying for her third loan of 65,000 KES to buy additional water tanks needed for her business. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children. 

Mebakari's goal for the future is to own a well-established water distribution depot in the area, so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase additional water tanks for her business.

loans.name: Cheikh Tidiane

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh A Tidiane est un homme retraité qui vit dans une des localités villageoises du Sénégal. Afin de ne pas rester oisif après la retraite il a choisi de se lancer dans le commerc ce qui lui permettra de gagner des revenus additionnels a sa pension afin de pouvoir continuer a subvenir a ses besoins primaires voire assister sa famille. Il pratique la vente de gaz  butane dans un local situé a proximité du marché du quartier de sa zone d’habitation. Il est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC de la zone, ou il a déjà remboursé  un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour renforcer son fond de roulement pour l’achat de gaz afin d’augmenter la distribution pour sa clientèle. Il est marié et participe a la gestion des charges de la famille. Il a une expérience de plusieurs années dans son activité( en même temps il commercialise aussi des bonbonnes de gaz. Il démarre sa journée de travail a 9 heures le matin pour terminer a 18 heures de l’après midi. Avec ce financements et l’augmentation de ses revenus il souhaite prendre en charge la scolarité de ses petits fils et aussi contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille.. Son vœu futur consiste a acquérir un second magasin de dépôt et vente de gaz et de bonbonnes.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh A Tidiane is a retiree who lives in a village in Senegal. To avoid being idle in his retirement, he chose to launch a business enabling him to earn income beyond his pension, so he can continue supporting himself and even attend to his family. He sells butane gas at a spot located near the district market where he lives. 

He is a member of the area's U-IMCEC branch where he has already paid back a previous loan. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for bolstering his working capital to purchase butane, which will increase the distribution for his customers. 

He is married and helps in managing family expenses. He has several years of experience in his business (selling gas cylinders at the same time). His day starts at 9 AM and ends at 6 PM. With this financing and the revenue increases, he would like to pay for his grandchildren's schooling costs and also to help improve his family's food situation. His wish for the future is to acquire another storehouse and sell butane and gas cylinders.

loans.use: to purchase butane to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Wiomoah (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Adjoa is married and has three children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of charcoal, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of tablecloths and bags.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ekua sells charcoal in Wiomoah (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 10 years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have four children. Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Even though Aya grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Aya is an entrepreneur. She sells FuFu (a local dish) in Wiomoah (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 10 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. 

Aya has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more cassava, allowing her to produce more FuFu to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aya wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, allowing her to produce more FuFu (a local dish) to sell.

loans.name: Mirtha Paulina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Mirtha, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 6  y 4 años,  los dos mayores estudian en escuela y el menor en jardín de infantes. El marido trabaja en una cooperativa de transporte.

Doña Mirtha para obtener sus ingresos para sus gastos y también con esto ayudar a su esposo y para los estudios de sus hijos se dedica al comercio, ella  vende ropa y zapatos por catalogo y productos de Esika y Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días por las tardes, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada quince días, lleva más de 10 años en este negocio  y gracias a esto ella puede salir adelante y solventar los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y uniformes de escuelas para aprovechar la temporada de entrada a clases. Lleva más de 15 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le han ayudado. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The San Esteban communal bank meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto.  This place is known for its traditional culture.  It is also a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Mirtha, age 37, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage and has three children, ages 11, 6, and 4.  The two oldest children go to school, and the youngest goes to pre-school.  Her husband works in a transportation cooperative.

Mirtha devotes herself to commerce in order to get income for her expenses, to help her husband, and for the children’s education.  She sells clothes and shoes by catalog.  She also sells Esika and Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She sells door to door.  She works every afternoon.  She sells to her customers on credit, and she collects every 15 days.  She has been in this business for over ten years.  Thanks to this she is able to get ahead and to pay for her children’s educational expenses.

This new loan is to buy clothes, shoes, and school uniforms in order to take advantage of the season when school starts.  She has been in the communal bank for over 15 years.  She likes it because the loans have always helped her.

Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and school uniforms.

loans.name: Qnarik

texts.en:
Qnarik is from a small village in the Shirak region, which is one of the oldest and most beautiful regions of Armenia. Locals here are mostly involved in cattle breeding and some limited land cultivation.

Qnarik keeps livestock and cultivates wheat. Her livestock currently includes 60 chickens, 10 bulls, 5 cows, 5 colonies of bees and 2 pigs. A very hardworking woman, she and her husband work hard to sustain their family of six consisting of Qnarik herself, her husband, grandparents and two sons, both of whom serve in the army.

The income that Qnarik and her husband earn from cattle breeding is hardly enough to cover the family's daily costs, and additional income is vital for them. Because they own old agro machinery that needs to be renovated, she has requested this loan which will result in their work being more effective.

Qnarik does her best to save money to ensure a better life for her sons.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of agro machinery

loans.name: Kirinkai

texts.en:
Kirinkai is 59 years old, married and supports a family of 10 members. He is a mixed farmer, and he has been in the business for the last eight years. His monthly income is 39,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He learnt about KADET from other farmers in his locality. 

Kirinkai is currently servicing his fourth loan of 80,000 KES from KADET Ltd. to prepare the land and purchase farm inputs. Kirinkai plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. His future dream is to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to prepare the land and purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and supplies for work

loans.name: Nooretet

texts.en: Nooretet is now 40 years old and has successfully paid off her previous loan. Her farming business is doing well as she gets support from the family. She has managed to get a flock of livestock for her farm produce. She has applied for her third loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings which will facilitate land preparation as well as the purchase of farm inputs. She plans to enlarge her farm from her increased proceeds. She hopes to raise the family's living standards by educating her children.

loans.use: to prepare the farm and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a charcoal seller and has been in this business for twelve years. Christine is a married mother of one school-age child.
Christine was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 21,050 KES to purchase new stock of charcoal. She will pay for her children’s school fee with the extra income generated.
Despite the challenge of high cost of transportation, Christine believes the business has a future. Besides her gaining income to educate her child, she looks forward to owning a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Chadi

texts.en:
Chadi is a resident of Mariakani area of the Coast province in Kenya. She owns a retail business which she sells fish. She is a married mother of five children and has been running the business for two years.
Chadi was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase more stock of fish to sell. The challenge that the business faces is the high cost of transportation to the main area where she obtains the fish.
She will use the extra income from the loan to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to to purchase more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Silus
